text:
With delight I noticed that there are <http> and <socket> conditions available 
since version 1.5
This is very useful and I am looking forward to writing whole network 
monitoring scripts with these new features. I would like to propose to add
a <dns> condition so that it is possible to check for correct name resolutions
even without connecting to the resolved socket.
One could also think about further conditions or tasks that would make sense 
within the context of network monitoring. <ping> would be nice, <tracert> would 
be awesome. <snmp>, <wbem> or <jmx> tasks that could emit traps/events or 
get/set attributes would be groundbreaking.
creator: wtff@freenet.de
stevel@apache.org
text:
ant1.6 is planned to have a <hostname> task that would put the local host into a
property; extending this to set a property to another host (and leave the
property set if unresolvable) would be possible, were you to supply the patches.


ping and tracert are impossible to write in pure Java, unless you know something
Sun doesnt; 'add ICMP support' to Java is stull an RFE on Java, I beleive.

thanks for pointing me to the hostname task.

--

ping & tracert:

aaah, yes of course, I forgot about that. So lets drop ping and tracert.
(The same issue also prevents support for snmp tasks I believe.)

But what do you think about jmx/wbem support in ant 2.0 ?
At sun, a wbem api is being developed within one JSR, as well as JMX remoting 
and JMX 1.5
As soon as these APIs are available, it might be easy to add some nice features 
to Ant which would enable Ant to be used as a sophisticated network management 
tool or a reporting tool that could monitor or check certain conditions and 
emit traps to a management platform.
creator: wtff@freenet.de
stevel@apache.org

reopening bug to remind me to finish off documentation and related stuff.
since  it is open to remind *you* ;-)
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
<isreachable> does a DNS lookup *first*; no resolve -> not reachable. then it
does a ping on java1.5+ . We could make the ping optional, as that is better for
doing long haul tests. I.e. 

<isreachable url="http://apache.org/" > only works in some situations, and not
others, depending on where my laptop is. adding a ping="true" switch would give
better java compatibility (on java1.4 and below, if ping=true we'd just warn
that it was absent)
creator: stevel@apache.org
